description:
A swatch is a small sample of knitting used to measure gauge and test fabric characteristics before starting a project.

Machine knitters use swatches to check:
• Stitch and row gauge
• Yarn behavior (shrinkage, drape, or stretch)
• Tension settings and finishing effects

Always record your stitch and row counts, the tension dial setting, and any notes about the yarn. A properly measured and labeled swatch helps ensure your finished project matches the intended size and fit.
tooltip: A small sample of knitting used to measure gauge and test fabric before starting a project.
example: Knit a 60-stitch by 80-row swatch at tension 6 to measure your gauge before casting on the full piece.
